New Records: Trent Boult recorded 2 wickets with 45 runs in 10 overs, with an economy of 4.50.
Lockie Ferguson scored 3 wickets with 49 runs in 10 overs, with an economy of 4.90.
Kane Williamson retired hurt after scoring 78 runs off 107 balls.
Devon Conway scored 45 runs off 59 balls before being dismissed.
Bangladesh's total of 245/9 is their highest score in the match.
New Zealand's 248/2 is their highest score in the match.
Key Match Events: Lockie Ferguson was named Player of the Match for his impactful performance.
Bangladesh lost 9 wickets for 245 runs, while New Zealand lost 2 wickets for 248 runs.
The match was a high-scoring encounter with a significant win margin.
Key turning points included the dismissal of Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim late in the innings.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and elected to field first.
Bangladesh had a strong batting lineup, but their performance was inconsistent throughout the innings.
New Zealand's bowling attack was dominant, taking regular wickets and limiting Bangladesh's scoring options.
Post-Match Reflections: Lockie Ferguson expressed satisfaction with his performance and the team's win.
New Zealand's captain Kane Williamson praised the team's resilience and adaptability.
The win boosted New Zealand's confidence ahead of their next matches in the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.
The attendance was 14,369 fans, showing strong support for the match.
The match was a crucial one for New Zealand's campaign in the World Cup.
Others: The match was part of the 2023-24 ICC Cricket World Cup.
New Zealand's victory extended their unbeaten record in the tournament.
The match was a high-scoring encounter with several review decisions impacting the outcome.
